Ingredients-

1. 4 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
2. 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
3. 1 tablespoon mayonnaise
4. 1 pound broccoli florets, cooked
5. 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
6. 1 cup dry stuffing mix

Steps-

Step 1-Gather all ingredients. 
Step 2-Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 
Step 3-Place chicken breasts in a large pot and add enough water to completely cover the chicken in liquid; bring to a gentle simmer. Cover tightly with a lid and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 15 minutes. 
Step 4-Remove chicken from the pot and cut into bite-sized pieces when cool enough to handle. 
Step 5-Mix together condensed soup and mayonnaise in a bowl. 
Step 6-Layer chicken in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer cooked broccoli over top, then soup mixture, and finally Cheddar cheese. 
Step 7-Sprinkle dry stuffing mix over top. 
Step 8-Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and cheese has melted, 25 to 30 minutes. 
Step 9-Serve hot and enjoy!
